question.text: In the <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> cycle, the primary <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> acceptor is a 3C molecule ...(i)........ and is present in the mesophyll cells. The enzyme responsible for this fixation is .....(ii).....

solution.text: <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math>  plants shows Kranz anatomy in which mesophyll chloroplast differs from bundle sheath chloroplast. In  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math>  cycle the primary  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  acceptor is a 3C molecule PEP and is present in the mesophyll cells. The enzyme responsible for this fixation is PEP carboxylase.
